discussion.p: In Table 114 – Floating-point conversions [tab:facet.num.put.fp] we specify that a floating-point value should be printed as if by `%f` when (flags & floatfield) == fixed. This ignores whether `uppercase` is also set in `flags`, meaning there is no way to use the conversion specifier `%F` that was added to `printf` in C99.

That's fine for finite values, because 1.23 in fixed format has no exponent character and no hex digits that would need to use uppercase. But `%f` and `%F` are not equivalent for non-finite values, because `%F` prints `"NAN"` and `"INF"` (or `"INFINITY"`). It seems there is no way to print `"NAN"` or `"INF"` using `std::num_put`.
